title: Hyson Green Market tram stop
text:
Hyson Green Market is a tram stop on the <a href="Nottingham%20Express%20Transit">Nottingham Express Transit</a> network, serving the suburb of <a href="Hyson%20Green">Hyson Green</a>, <a href="Nottingham">City of Nottingham</a> in <a href="Nottinghamshire">Nottinghamshire</a>, England.
History.
The stop opened on 9 March 2004, as part of the first phase of the network, between <a href="Hucknall%20station">Hucknall</a> or <a href="Phoenix%20Park%20tram%20stop">Phoenix Park</a> and <a href="Station%20Street%20tram%20stop">Station Street</a>. It is located on a one-way section of the tramway, and is served only by southbound trams. The nearest northbound stop is <a href="Noel%20Street%20tram%20stop">Noel Street</a>. It has one side platform flanking the single track, which is shared with other road traffic.
On 25 August 2015, the network was extended south, with branches to <a href="Clifton%20South%20tram%20stop">Clifton South</a> and <a href="Toton%20Lane%20tram%20stop">Toton Lane</a>.
Services.
As of January 2022, services operate at a combined 3–8 minute frequency between <a href="David%20Lane%20tram%20stop">David Lane</a> and <a href="Nottingham%20station">Nottingham Station</a>. Heading south, trams continue to <a href="Clifton%20South%20tram%20stop">Clifton South</a> and <a href="Toton%20Lane%20tram%20stop">Toton Lane</a> up to every 7–15 minutes. Heading north, trams continue to <a href="Hucknall%20station">Hucknall</a> and <a href="Phoenix%20Park%20tram%20stop">Phoenix Park</a> up to every 7–15 minutes.
Rolling stock used: <a href="Alstom%20Citadis">Alstom Citadis</a> and <a href="Bombardier%20Incentro%20AT6/5">Bombardier Incentro</a>
